intro: Platyrhaphe, commonly known as the flat-leaf grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. These plants are typically found in wetland or marshy environments, where they thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Platyrhaphe species are often used in ecological restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity. Their growth habits make them important components of wetland ecosystems.
